title: Sky Sports presenter Hayley McQueen gives birth to baby girl
text:
Sky Sports presenter Hayley McQueen, 39, has welcomed a baby daughter to the world with her fiancé Kirk Newmann after documenting her fertility battles.

Sharing a sweet snap on Instagram, the new mum was radiant as she posed from her hospital bed alongside Kirk, while in another duo of snaps they took it in turns to hold her before she also shared a Wikipedia definition of the name Ayla.

She added a caption reading: 'Here she is! our darling baby daughter Ayla McQueen-Newmann, we couldn’t be more in love with her ❤️. The September baby that kept us waiting until October 3rd....

Happy days: Sky Sports presenter Hayley McQueen has welcomed a baby daughter to the world with her Kirk Newmann after documenting her fertility battles

'She arrived just in time for lunch, wide eyed, inquisitive & looks just like her daddy & a healthy 8lb 2oz. The name we chose couldn’t be more perfect for her with both Scottish & Turkish roots & my occasional nickname ‘Halo’.

Back in April, she confirmed her pregnancy news, branding Ayla a 'miracle' baby after years of struggling with 'horrific' endometriosis.

The reporter and award-winning producer from Manchester, unveiled the news on Instagram again and was lauded for the happy reveal.

Hayley, who doubted she could ever get pregnant, penned: 'BREAKING NEWS. I’d hoped having a baby was going to happen one day but wasn’t sure it ever would.

Delighted: Clearly enamoured with their new arrival, Hayley beamed while holding Ayla, while Kirk immediately got skin-on-skin contact as he clutched the tot

Their little miracle: Back in April, she confirmed her pregnancy news, branding Ayla a 'miracle' baby after years of struggling with 'horrific' endometriosis

Sweet: She shared the definition of the name as she delightedly announced her news

'Baby McQueen-Newmann has been cooking away for a few months now and pleased to report so far so good. We feel so incredibly blessed.'

She also told how she first discovered she was pregnant the day she and fiancée, German-born model and actor Kirk, were about to embark on IVF.

In the post, Hayley went on to explain that the couple had struggled for years with their fertility, 'sorting out horrific endometriosis' and getting rid of 'pesky cysts.'

Joy of joys: She said that her fiancé was 'ever the optimist' and always believed they would conceive naturally

Happy days: Hayley told how she first discovered she was pregnant the day she and fiancée (pictured in July), Kirk Newmann were about to embark on IVF

'Just as we we were about to embark on an IVF journey abroad I found out I was expecting. In fact, the very day I spoke to the embryologist to map out my cycle and dates was the day we found out.'

She said that her fiancé was 'ever the optimist' and always believed they would conceive naturally.

Hayley has been documenting her pregnancy closely online, with her entire Instagram feed littered with snaps of her bump and pregnancy updates.

The happiest news: The Sky Sports presenter was over the moon to discover she is expecting her first baby and called her pregnancy 'a miracle'
